summary: This document appears to be a page from grand jury material listing criminal charges against Jeffrey Epstein for enticement of a minor and travel to engage in illicit sexual conduct between July 2004 and January 2005. It references a confidential witness identified as Jane Doe #7.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Listed as the defendant facing multiple counts of enticement of a minor and travel to engage in illicit sexual conduct.

persons.name: Jane Doe #7
persons.context: Identified as a confidential witness referenced in the grand jury material.

connections.description: Epstein is the defendant charged with crimes, and Jane Doe #7 is referenced as a confidential witness in the grand jury material, suggesting she is a victim or witness to his alleged conduct.

events.title: Epstein charged with enticement
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein is charged with enticement of a minor to engage in prostitution, with the offense period spanning from July 22, 2004 to January 31, 2005.

events.title: Recruiting minor for commercial sex
events.description: Epstein is charged with recruiting, enticing, providing, or obtaining a minor knowing she would be caused to engage in a commercial sex act, with the offense period spanning from July 22, 2004 to January 31, 2005.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein faced multiple federal charges including enticement of a minor and travel to engage in illicit sexual conduct.
The charges span from July 2004 through January 2005, indicating a pattern of alleged criminal activity during this period.
The document is marked as confidential grand jury material, suggesting it was part of secret proceedings.
A witness identified as Jane Doe #7 is referenced, indicating the involvement of at least one victim whose identity is protected.
The document lists specific counts with dates, showing the government's detailed chronology of Epstein's alleged offenses.
